definition: to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
ticket/ballot/banknote/CL:張|张[zhang1]/person held for ransom/amateur performance of Chinese opera/classifier for groups, batches, business transactions
to make use of one's position to gain profit for oneself or one's associates
to open ballot boxes/to count votes/to make out a voucher or invoice etc/to write out a receipt
a deal where the parties collude to sign an under-the-table "yin contract" 陰合同|阴合同 as well as an ostensibly genuine "yang contract" 陽合同|阳合同 in order to deceive authorities
covert activities (election rigging etc)/under-the-table manipulations/black operations
system for identifying users (on a rail network, the Internet etc)
to be affiliated with/to operate under the wing of/affiliation
"drugs serving to nourish doctors", perceived problem in PRC medical practice
to resell at a profit/to speculate
smuggler, esp. of electronic goods from Macao or Hong Kong to Guangdong/boatman/fisherman/itinerant trader
